sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It's Monday the 2nd of May. Good morning Europe, thank you for joining us. Let's begin by looking at our top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: After months underground, dozens of civilians are evacuated from a besieged steel plant in Ukraine's war-torn city of Mariupol.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But hundreds more remain inside.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Protesters and parrots clash with police as traditional May Day demonstrations turn violent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And EU Energy Ministers hold crisis talks in the face of Russian threats to cut off oil and gas to the block.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: There's been sporadic shelling by Russian forces of the war-torn city Mariupol's besieged steel plant following a partial evacuation of civilians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: That's according to Ukrainian sources.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: On Sunday, the Russian Defense Ministry released footage of what it said was the evacuation of civilians from the Azov-style steel complex in the centre of the city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Other footage released by Ukrainian Azov forces showed some of the 100 people being helped to leave their underground shelters before being bussed out of the area to both Russian-controlled and Ukraine-controlled territory after weeks of being under siege.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The children had been asking for food all the time, said one woman.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The adults had endured the hunger better.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The Azov military came to our bunker and said that they were searching our apartments.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: They shouted, claiming that most of the city was pro-Russian.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: They told us they had entered lots of apartments and had seen the Russian flag on display in almost all of them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: To be honest, I don't have a Russian flag in my apartment, or a Ukrainian one.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: President Zelensky thanked the UN and the Red Cross for helping organize the evacuation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Today we finally managed to start the evacuation of people from Azovstal. After many weeks of negotiations, after many attempts, different meetings with different people, calls, countries, proposals â€“ finally, there was not a single day when we were not trying to find a solution to save our people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: As many as 100,000 people are still believed to be blockaded in Mariupol, including up to 1,000 civilians who are hunkered down with an estimated 2,000 Ukrainian fighters beneath the Soviet-era steel plant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, Moscow is preparing for national celebrations on the 9th of May, marking the country's World War II victory over Nazi Germany.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: As Euronews correspondent Galina Polonskaya reports.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The Russian military will not artificially adjust their deadline in Ukraine to the 9th of May, Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov has said in an interview to the Italian TV broadcaster media set.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The rehearsals for the highly symbolic 9th of May military parade on Red Square have already taken place in Moscow, and this Sunday state media showed rallies dedicated to another national holiday, the 1st of May.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: There were images of people with Soviet flags and cars decorated with the letter Z, incorporated in the letters of the traditional Peace, Labour, May slogan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But there were also other posters and symbols on the streets.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The OVD Info Police watchdog reported that more than 30 protesters were detained in various Russian cities on Sunday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: One of them, Anna Anisimova, chained herself in St. Petersburg in front of a TV set decorated with a photo of one of the top pro-Kremlin TV anchors and the letter Z written on it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Galina Polonskaya, Euronews from Paris.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: France's interior minister has condemned the violence on the streets of Paris during traditional

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: May Day demonstrations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Gerald Darmanin called protesters who clashed with the police thugs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Police used tear gas to push back anarchists who ransacked shops in the French capital.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: 54 people were arrested, including a woman who it's reported attacked a fireman as he tried to put out a fire.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Eight police officers were injured.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In a tweet, Darmanin announced that he was following the disruption of the demonstrations committed with unacceptable violence and said that he fully supports police officers who are the guarantors of the right to protest and public order.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Around 250 rallies were organized in Paris and other cities including Lille, Nantes, Toulouse and Marseille.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Most were peaceful.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The rising cost of living and government plans to increase the retirement age to 65 from 62 were the main issues being demonstrated out.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi kicks off a three-day tour of Europe today, where he'll

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: be holding bilateral talks to Germany, Denmark and France.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Following European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen's visit to Delhi last week, Modi is looking to negotiate a free trade deal with Brussels and strengthen ties with the European Union.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But his trip comes at a sensitive time, with India and the EU split on their response to Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Our reporter Jonah Calgren has more from Berlin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi will of course get the high-level red carpet treatment during his visit to Berlin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: There will be military honors and certainly a meeting with the German Chancellor Olaf Scholz.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But there are disagreements between these two countries, especially when it comes to the Russian invasion of Ukraine. India has refused to join the sanctions against Russia and India has announced that it will continue to buy Russian oil and that might undercut expected sanctions that the EU is expected to announce in the coming days targeting Russian oil. However, it's unclear if Olaf Scholz, someone who has himself been criticized heavily for not supporting the Ukrainians enough, will be able to change Modi's mind. Jonah Kellgren, Euronews, Berlin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: India could be entering its hottest summer in history, as a scorching heat wave breaks monthly records.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: As temperatures climb well over 40 degrees Celsius, people are being told to stay indoors and drink plenty of water.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It is so hot that the vegetables are rotting, this grocer says.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We don't get enough water here.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This taxi driver has a fan at home but no electricity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: I also don't have clean water at home.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The water is dirty. it makes us sick." Farmers say the severe weather is affecting the harvest season as it's begun unusually early.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Suresh Singh says his crops have suffered.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Due to the sudden rise in temperature, the water table has dropped.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The great heat has decimated our crop yield by half.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: This river in Delhi is almost completely dry.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Many experts say the more frequent extreme heat in India is undeniably a result of climate change.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Pakistani women shop for henna and bangles at a market in Multan in Punjab province amid preparations for Eid al-Futur, the festival of breaking the fast of the month-long Ramadan, and celebrated by Muslims worldwide.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But a failure to see the new moon in Pakistan has delayed the celebrations there until Tuesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Palestinians flock to the markets to shop for cakes, sweets and fasiq, which is a traditional salty fermented fish dish.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Fasiq should be the main meal of the first day of Eid al-Fitr.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The first thing we do is eat fasiq and there are several different types.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In Lebanon, as they prepare for the festivities, people make mahamoul, traditional holiday cookies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The situation has become very tragic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: You work and work with no outcome.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: You're working hard, but your children are being denied many things.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: You feel that your life has changed a lot compared to what it used to be.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And as the festival approaches, so traffic increases, leading to a road safety campaign being staged in Tunis.
